answers.answer: Hi!Migraine during pregnancy can be caused due to number of causes like pregnancy hormones, imbalance of the brain chemicals, altered blood flow to the brain etc.Few women may experience severe migraine in pregnancy while few of them may have decreased symptoms.Chocolates,Chinese foods, processed meat, bright glaring lights, lack of sleep, stress all can act as triggers of migraine.Migarine sufferers are at increased risk to develop hypertension and preeclampsia so you need to be careful and be closely monitored by your doctor. Acetaminophen is the safest medicine. If you are aware about the triggering factors try to avoid them.Rest, relaxation, use of cold compresses on forehead can be helpful. Yoga and a daily walk can alleviate stress and prevent migraine attacks. Do keep us updated on how you are doing.Best wishes!

question: This has been a long journey for me bc I have not been able to completely enjoy my pregnancy because of my strong headaches which lead to throwing up.  It's not my blood pressure bc thats is great and I'm six months or 25 weeks tomorrow.  I went to the hospital but the say it's normal. What do I do? Btw tylenol is my best friend.
title: Strong migraines during pregnancy
